description: This special book written to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the moon landing combines the story of the preparation, journey, arrival, and landing of Apollo 11 with scientific information about the Moon and its influence on our culture through music, theater, literature, and more.
contents: Contents: Countdown ; Liftoff! ; The Moon ; Moonlight ; How it All Began ; Ancient Explanations ; Toward Science ; Into Orbit! ; What's in a Name? ; Spacemen ; Muslim Foundations ; Moon Gods ; Moon Goddesses ; Moon Worship ; Science's Revolution ; Moon Probes ; Apollo -- The Tragedy ; Newton's Moon ; Hey Diddle Diddle! ; Man in the Moon ; Creation ; Moon Men! The Mighty Saturn ; Moon Movies ; Moon Horror ; On Target ; The Changing Moon ; Moonlit Love ; Eclipse ; The Pioneers ; Time and Tide ; Moon Music ; Zero Hour.

Contents: Moon Song ; Moon Matter ; Here We Come! ; The Eagle Has Landed! ; Moon Map ; The White Beauty ; One Small Step ; Dramatic Moon ; Lunar Atmosphere ; Men from Earth ; Lunar Gravity ; Lunacy ; Homeward Bound ; The Dark Side ; Splashdown! ; The Moon as a Symbol ; Art and Science ; Painted Moon ; Return to the Moon ; Living on the Moon ; Unseen Influence ; Lunar Dating ; Moonbeams ; Moon Info ; Moon Dates ; Moon Sites.
lds02: Originally published: Oxford [England] : Oxford University Press, 2009.

Moon
Outer space
publisher: Culver City, California : Sony Pictures Home Entertainment
description: Astronaut Sam Bell is completing a three-year contract with Lunar Industries to mine Earth's primary source of energy on the dark side of the moon: Helium-3. His declining health is causing headaches and hallucinations that lead to a near-fatal accident, rendering him unconscious. After recuperating, an unexpected discovery leads him to doubt his sanity, his identity, and the integrity of the company. Believing he is alone on his mission, his sole purpose is getting back home on his own.
contributor: Sony Pictures Classics (Firm), presenter.$$QSony Pictures Classics (Firm)

genre: Video recordings for the hearing impaired
lds02: Originally released as a motion picture in 2009.

Special features: commentary with writer/director Duncan Jones, director of photography, concept designer and production designer; commentary with writer/director Duncan Jones and producer Stuart Fenegan; "Whistle," a short film by Duncan Jones; the making of Moon; creating the visual effects; Science Center Q & A with director; filmmaker's Q & A at the Sundance Film Festival; theatrical trailer.
Director of photography, Gary Shaw ; editor, Nicolas Gaster ; music, Clint Mansell.
lds08: Cast: Sam Rockwell, Dominique McElligott, Kaya Scodelario, Benedict Wong, Matt Berry, Malcolm Stewart, Kevin Spacey (voice).

creator: Gavron, Jeremy.$$QGavron, Jeremy.
description: A white boy grows up on his family's farm in Kenya in the 1950's. The escalating racial tension in the country affects the boy's relationship with his father's African driver.

Moon
creator: Williams, Edgar Mark, 1960- author.$$QWilliams, Edgar Mark
description: "Long before a rocket hit the Man in the Moon in the eye in Georges Méliès's early film Le Voyage dans la Lune, the earth's lone satellite had entranced humans. We have worshipped it as a deity, believed it to cause madness, used it as a means of organizing time, and we now know that it manipulates the tides--our understanding of the moon continues to evolve. Following the moon from its origins to its rich cultural resonance in literature, art, religion, and politics, Moon provides a comprehensive account of the significance of our lunar companion..."--Book flap.
contents: Contents: Introduction -- Lunar shadows -- Time and motion -- Stories and legends -- Man and the moon -- Lunar art and literature -- One small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind -- Legacy -- Timeline for moon landings.

abstract: "Long before a rocket hit the Man in the Moon in the eye in Georges Méliès's early film Le Voyage dans la Lune, the earth's lone satellite had entranced humans. We have worshipped it as a deity, believed it to cause madness, used it as a means of organizing time, and we now know that it manipulates the tides--our understanding of the moon continues to evolve. Following the moon from its origins to its rich cultural resonance in literature, art, religion, and politics, Moon provides a comprehensive account of the significance of our lunar companion..."--Book flap.
